title.narrative: OUTPUT 7.4. EMERGENCY RESPONSE / SOCIALPOLICY, PLANNING MONITORING & EVALUATION

description.narrative: By end 2021, government actors at national and local levels are generating evidence on emergency situations, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews, Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews (Covid), Economic And Social Policy General, Reducing Child Poverty, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 7: By the end of 2022, the Government makes better use of knowledge about the situation of children, especially the most disadvantaged, in decision-making and implements inclusive development policies and strategies with youth and adolescents' participation

title.narrative: By end 2021, government actors at national and local levels are generating evidence on emergency situations

description.narrative: In 2021, UNICEF supported the development of internal and national capacities for the establishment of an adaptive social protection system by improving the knowledge of key;actors, creating awareness on the role of social protection and technical advice;to ensure better response to shocks and more resilience-focused programming at the national and;decentralized;levels. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:24/01/2022
